intro: Gomphogyne longgangensis, commonly known as the Longgang gomphogyne, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its unique morphological features, including its clustered leaves and distinctive inflorescence. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, which helps it blend with its surroundings. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
